question:
Identify the INCORRECT statement for the universal law of gravitation.

SSC CPO 05/10/23 (Afternoon)
option_1: It is the force that binds us to earth
option_2: It is the force causing rides due to the stars and earth
option_3: It is the force that keeps motion of planets around the sun
option_4: It is the force that assists motion of the moon around earth
solution:
• The universal law of gravitation states that every object in the universe attracts every other object with a force directly proportional to their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.
  • This force binds us to Earth, keeps planets in orbit around the Sun, and moons orbiting their planets.
  • However, gravitational force does not directly cause tides due to stars and Earth; tides are primarily caused by the gravitational pull of the Moon and, to a lesser extent, the Sun.
  • Therefore, the INCORRECT statement is (b) "It is the force causing rides due to the stars and Earth."

Additional Information:

  • Newton’s Law of Universal Gravitation Formula:

  • F = Gravitational Force
  • G = Universal Gravitational Constant (674 × 10⁻¹¹ N·m²/kg²)
  • m₁, m₂ = Masses of two objects
  • r = Distance between their centers
  • Tides occur due to the Moon's gravitational pull:
    • High tides happen when the Moon is overhead or opposite Earth.
    • Low tides occur between high tide phases.
    • Spring tides happen when the Sun, Earth, and Moon align (strongest tides).
    • Neap tides occur when the Moon and Sun form a right angle (weaker tides).

question:
Identify the correct statement about gravity.

SSC CPO 05/10/23 (Afternoon)
option_1: The unit of g is the same as that of acceleration
option_2: The unit of g is the same as that of velocity
option_3: The unit of g is the same as that of mass
option_4: The unit of g is the same as that of friction
solution:
• Gravity (g) represents acceleration due to gravity, which is the rate at which objects accelerate towards Earth.
  • The unit of g is m/s² (meters per second squared), which is the same as the unit of acceleration.
  • Since acceleration has the same unit as gravity, the correct answer is (a) The unit of g is the same as that of acceleration.

Additional Information:

  • The standard value of g on Earth is 8 m/s², but it varies slightly with altitude and location.
  • Other quantities and their units:
    • Velocity → m/s (meters per second)
    • Mass → kg (kilogram)
    • Friction is a force measured in Newton (N).
  • Acceleration due to gravity formula:

F = mg

  • F = Force (Newtons)
  • m = Mass (kg)
  • g = Acceleration due to gravity (m/s²)

question:
Who among the following was the first to conclude that in vacuum all objects fall with the same acceleration g and reach the ground at the same time?

SSC CGL 17/08/21 (Evening)
solution:
• Galileo Galilei was the first to conclude that in a vacuum, all objects fall with the same acceleration regardless of their mass.
  • He experimented by dropping objects from the Leaning Tower of Pisa, demonstrating that gravitational acceleration (g) is independent of mass.
  • The correct answer is (b) Galileo Galilei.

Additional Information:

  • Galileo’s discovery led to Newton’s formulation of the laws of motion and universal gravitation.
  • Acceleration due to gravity (g) on Earth is approximately 9.8 m/s².
  • In the presence of air resistance, lighter objects fall slower, but in a vacuum, all objects fall at the same rate.

question:
Which instrument was used to detect gravitational waves for the very first time?

SSC CHSL 17/03/20 (Evening)
solution:
• LIGO (Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory) was the first instrument to successfully detect gravitational waves.
  • The detection occurred in 2015, confirming a key prediction of Einstein’s General Theory of Relativity.

Additional Information:

  • Gravitational waves are ripples in space-time caused by massive cosmic events like black hole mergers.
  • LIGO consists of two detectors, located in Washington and Louisiana, USA.

question:
The Law of Gravitation was given by _________ .

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The Law of Gravitation was proposed by Isaac Newton in 1687.
  • It states that every particle in the universe attracts every other particle with a force that is:
    • Directly proportional to the product of their masses
    • Inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them
  • The mathematical form of the law is:

    F = G × (m₁ × m₂) / r²,

    where F is the gravitational force, G is the gravitational constant, m₁ & m₂ are the masses, and r is the distance between them.

  • This law helped in explaining the motion of celestial bodies like planets and moons.

Additional Information:

  • Galileo Galilei conducted experiments on falling bodies but didn’t formulate the gravitational law.
  • Albert Einstein gave the General Theory of Relativity, which refined Newton’s gravity at cosmic scales.
  • Charles Darwin is known for the Theory of Evolution, not for physics.

question:
Gravitational force is defined by the force of attraction between-

RRB Group-D 08/10/2018 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Gravitational force is the force of attraction between two masses.
  • It is a universal force that acts between any two objects having mass, regardless of their state or medium.
  • It acts along the line joining their centers and is always attractive in nature.
  • This concept was formalized by Isaac Newton as part of his Law of Universal Gravitation.
  • Unlike magnetic or electric forces, gravitational force depends only on mass and distance, not on charge or magnetism.

Additional Information:

  • Electrostatic force acts between two charges, not masses.
  • Magnetic force acts between magnetic materials or poles, not general masses.
  • Option (d) "Multiple masses" is incorrect because gravitational force is specifically between any two masses at a time.

question:
Which of the following among is a weak force?

RRB Group-D 26/10/2018 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Among the given options, the gravitational force is considered a weak force compared to other fundamental forces like strong nuclear force and electromagnetic force.
  • Gravitational force is the weakest of the four fundamental forces but acts over long distances and affects all masses.
  • Momentum force is not a fundamental force; momentum is a physical quantity.
  • Mass is a property of matter, not a force.
  • Short range force refers to forces like the strong nuclear force, which is much stronger but acts only over very small distances.

Therefore, the correct answer is (b) Gravitational force.

Additional Information:

  • The other fundamental forces are:
    • Strong nuclear force (strongest, short range)
    • Electromagnetic force
    • Weak nuclear force
  • Gravitational force governs the motion of planets, stars, and galaxies despite being weak.

question:
Which of the following statements is / are false?

A. The value of G is the same as its value on the moon, on Earth.

B. The gravitational force between the centers of two masses of 2 kg placed at a distance of 1 m is 26.68 10-11 Nm2/kg2

C. The force is inversely proportional to the square of the distance between the two objects.

D. The force of gravity between two objects doubles when the distance between them is halved.

RRB Group-D 31/10/2018 (Shift-I)


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1749723577640_image010.png
option_1: C and D only
option_4: B, C and D
solution:
• Statement A:

    The gravitational constant (G) remains the same everywhere in the universe, whether it's on the Earth, the Moon, or any other place.

    Thus, Statement A is true.

  • Statement B:

    If two objects each having a mass of 2 kg are placed at a distance of 1 meter, the gravitational force calculated matches the given value (26.68 × 10⁻¹¹ N).

    Thus, Statement B is true.

  • Statement C:

    The gravitational force between two objects becomes weaker as the distance between them increases. Specifically, it decreases by the square of the distance.

    Thus, Statement C is true.

  • Statement D:

    If the distance between two objects is halved, the gravitational force doesn't become double, it becomes four times stronger (since force varies inversely with the square of the distance).

    Thus, Statement D is false.

Hence, only Statement D is false.

Additional Information:

  • The gravitational constant (G) is universally constant.
  • Reducing distance drastically increases gravitational force.
